column6: Job/Team Function

column5: Permanent Secretary of the Department of Health
column6: 'Leadership and management of the Department of Health. Ensuring the department operates efficiently and coherently as a department of state in support of Ministers, including effective cross-Government working.'

'Provide leadership to - create an effective and efficient research system in the NHS, public health and social care that supports world-class research focused on the needs of patients and the public - commission reliable and relevant research to support decision-making about health and social care by patients, professionals and policy makers - support DH’s wider roles across Government particularly in relation to the key contribution that health research makes to improving national health and increasing national wealth.'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of Research Finance & Programmes
column6: 'Responsible for - commissioning research to inform DH and ALB policy; providing research evidence to underpin decisions about healthcare, public health and social care by professionals, patients and the public; supporting world-class researchers, conducting leading-edge research focused on patients and the public; discharging the responsibilities via the DH Policy Research Programme, and through NIHR research and training programmes; oversight of policy for commissioning, managing and funding research'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of  Research Infrastructure and Growth
column6: 'Responsible for - creating world-class research infrastructure in the NHS to speed up translation of leading-edge research into patient benefits and maximising NHS research potential to contribute to the country’s economic growth through the life sciences industries; forging and harnessing partnership between the NHS and Universities; leading on Research and Development relations with the life sciences industry, and working across government on the growth agenda.'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of Research Information and Intelligence
column6: 'Responsible for - maximising opportunities for better use of information to increase the evidence base of research and efficiency of the research system; mobilising research outputs and evaluating the impact of DH investment in research, and communicating the impacts to stakeholders'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of Research Standards and Support
column6: 'Responsible for - developing policies and delivering system reforms that ensure proportionate research regulation and management to speed up benefits for patients and improve the UK’s competitive advantage in the life sciences; overseeing the development and legislative basis for the Health Research Authority (HRA) and providing on-going sponsorship.'
column19: Cost of Reports added to RDD-009 Email form: http://www.info.doh.gov.uk/contactus.nsf/memo?openform

column5: Project Lead for the Dementia Summit
column6: 'To organise a G8 Dementia Summit as part of the UK’s presidency of the G8, and the PM’s domestic Dementia Challenge agenda.  '
column19: Cost of Reports added to PHD-019 Email form: http://www.info.doh.gov.uk/contactus.nsf/memo?openform

column5: Director General for Information & Group Operations
column6:
'Responsible for: delivering the Departments internal operational functions, successful delivery of the transition programme and ongoing
legacy for whole system reform.'

'Responsible for - Leading the closedown of the NHS Leadership team directorates and associated legacy activities post 31 March 2013.
Working with the Our DH Programme Board to re-focus and expand the DH transformation programme, making sure an appropriate
programme management framework is in place to enable successful delivery. Managing dependencies, interfaces, key risks and benefits realisation across the programme.'

'Responsible for - Leading the Shared Services Programme which covers finance, HR, payroll, occupational health and procurement. Scope of the programme includes DH and its ALBs with some organisations being out of scope for certain aspects of the programme.'

'Responsible for – leading and overseeing the strategy for information and information technology in the health and care system, and develop and lead the Digital programme for the health and care system.'

'Responsible for - Corporate governance and assurance for DH, our ALBs and the health and care system as a whole. Secretariat to DH boards and committees and risk management. Business planning and quarterly assessment. Support to ALB sponsors; public appointments.
Liaison with Cabinet Office on efficiency and reform. Oversight of internal audit.'

column5: Acting Director - NHS Estates & Facilities Policy
column6: 'Responsible for - National policy for NHS Estates & Facilities functions in relation to the provision of safe, clean, and suitable patient environments    '

'Responsible for - Provision of Corporate ICT and Information Services; Head of Profession for IT across DH IS and ALBs; Operational leadership and direction of DH IS and ALBs; Setting the strategic direction and policy for ICT and Information Services; Cross Government liaison and overall supplier governance'

'Responsible for: Departmental HR Strategy and policies All aspects of employment Learning & Development HR aspects of Business Management System Overseeing ALB HR governance and assurance Implementation of Civil Service HR & Shared Services'

'Co-ordinating and overseeing the Legacy Management Team post abolition of SHAs and PCTs. Overseeing the criteria for control and management of the team including ongoing reporting arrangements. Keeping the DG and Boards appraised on progress (plus CMB, DB, Ministers as directed by the DG). Representing the programme outside the department.'

column5: Head of ICT Futures & Shared Services
column6: 'Responsible for - Supporting the continuing Departmental transition for both DH & the ALBs'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of Internal Audit
column6: 'Responsible for - Delivering an Internal Audit function for the health family group through a shared service. Ensuring audit plans are in place and delivered for DH and its ALBs, giving confidence that assurance is in place for the system as a whole. Ensuring audit work meets the Public Sector Internal Audit quality standards.'

column5: Deputy Director - HR Business Partnering & Capability Development
column6: 'Responsible for - HR Business Partnering & Corporate Learning & Development'

column5: Project Manager, Future DH Business Solutions
column6: 'Responsible for - Managing the Future DH Business Solutions project – this project will support the successful implementation of all DH business readiness activities required to implement an outsourced Shared Service Centre for Finance, Procurement and HR, and introduce new, streamlined end-to-end processes across these functions.'
'Responsible for - lead, manage and drive coordination, risk and issue management for the resolution of people and associated issues arising post transition and abolition of SHAs and PCTs'

'Responsible for - business management for the Directorate including finance, workforce, business planning and governance. Financial planning, reporting and strategy for core DH administration costs. Policy lead for the costs and monetary benefits of the reforms. Responsibile for the DG’s private office.'
column19: Cost of Reports added to GOA-005 Email form: http://www.info.doh.gov.uk/contactus.nsf/memo?openform

column5: Deputy Director - Internal Communications, Connecting & Engagement
column6: 'Responsible for - Supporting the Permanent Secretary and the Director General of Group Operations and Assurance. Managing the Internal Communications and Engagement and Change teams. Designing and co-ordinating staff engagement events and channels including SCS forums and staff surveys. Managing and developing the integrated pay band Project Bank. Head of organisational development and change'
'Responsible for - Planning for future business needs for DH/ALBs promoting collaboration, knowledge sharing and different ways of working'

'Responsible for - manage and drive coordination, risk and issue management for the secure, cross-boundary closure, handover and legacy issues arising from the closure and transition of NHS SHAs and PCTs.'
'Responsible for - Providing operational business critical services across Estates; Facilities and Information Services both for DH/ALBs with a focus on continual service improvement'

'Responsible for - Management of the DH Secretariat which provides support to the Departmental Board and its committees. Overseeing the Board’s development and liaison with non-executive directors. Developing risk and assurance methodology for DH and its ALBs. Overseeing DH governance.'
'Responsible for: Business Reform'
'Partnerships & Information Division'

column5: Deputy Director - HR Operations & SCS Unit, HR Change Team
column6: 'Responsible for: HR Framework Displacement Exits (Change and Business as Usual) Staff Support Outplacement Restructuring SCS Unit Fast Stream - Strategy and Operations HR Services (Transactions and Casework)'

column5: DH Digital Leader and Deputy Director, Digital, Channel Strategy and Publishing
column6: 'Responsible for the Department’s digital strategy, digital services and transformation, channel strategies, social media strategy, electronic and printed publishing,  leading and aligning digital activities and services across the new health and care system, and Head of Profession for Digital.'

column5: Deputy Director - HR Policy & Workforce, Recruitment
column6: 'Responsible for: Policy, Diversity & Reward Workforce & Management Information Corporate Social Responsibility HR communications Business Continuity Corporate Business Industrial Relations Accountability Performance Management Dispute Resolution Recruitment & Gateways.'

column5: Deputy Director - Head of Group Capability development
column6: 'Responsible for - Leading the ALB Sponsorship Support Unit to enable the Department’s sponsor teams to deliver the Government’s health and care priorities effectively, efficiently, and with regard to value for money through the ALBs. Improving and embedding processes to publish an annual DH Corporate Pla, aligned more closely with our ALB partners, and implementing quarterly monitoring; leading the Departmental improvement planning process. Overseeing the process of public appointments of chairs and non-executives to ALBs.'
'Responsible for NHS Security.'
'Responsible for - Providing expert programme management skills to the Our DH Programme and supporting the projects to deliver their outcomes'

column5: Programme Director National Proton Beam Therapy Programme

column5: Deputy Director Inforamtion and Legal, Legacy Management Team
column6: 'Responsible for: Leading the teams reponsible for Reviews and Information, Litigation and Transfer Scheme modification'

'The Strategy and External Relations Directorate aims to transform the way the Department fulfils its vision for better care, better health and better value by setting policy, strategy and outcomes for information to support patients and public, to improve quality and safety of healthcare, overseeing the framework to improve engagement between DH and the public, improving policy-making and outcomes.'

column5: Director of Strategy, Quality and Analysis
column6: 'Lead DH’s strategy team, providing analysis, insight and raising the Department’s strategic capability, ensure that quality of care for patients and the public remains central to our strategy for health and care and as part of this to be the Departmental sponsor for the CQC and to lead on the quality regulation of hospitals, social care and other provider bodies. As DH Chief Analyst, provide governance and leadership for the analytical community across the Department. Ensure that the voice of patients and citizens is heard across the health and care system and insights are acted on'

column5: Director of Professional Standards and Employee Relations
column6: 'Responsible for pay, pensions, industrial relations, professional regulation and the Mid Staffordshire Public Inquiry'
'Planning the size and shape of the NHS workforce, ensuring high quality education and training, and adult social care workforce.'

'Responsible for managing DH’s corporate accountability to Parliament and the public. Specifically to support Ministers by managing and maintaining private offices to respond to all correspondence and FoI requests from MPs and the public to respond to all PQs and Parliamentary Business to process the Queens Honours nominations from the NHS and other health and social care organisations and DH employees.'

'Responsible for setting the Department’s communications strategy and priorities, and for consultation and engagement with external partners. Provides leadership across the Department on communications'
'Ensuring appropriate workforce planning and development in relation to delivery of education.'
'Supports the Department in developing its relationships with external partners and stakeholders, and its capability to engage with stakeholders'
'Supporting the development of a culture of compassionate care across the health and care sectors where quality of care is seen as important as quality of treatment'
'Provide support to DH and its Arm's Length Bodies to address the medium to long term strategic challenge. Build strategic and horizon scanning capabilities across DH'
column19: Cost of Reports added to SER219 Email form: http://www.info.doh.gov.uk/contactus.nsf/memo?openform

column6: 'SCS oversight on the strategy for the programme of integrated communications across England’s health and care systems in support of both the Prime Minister’s Dementia Challenge and also the Secretary of State for Health’s ambition to make England a global lead in caring for people with dementia. A part-time post working with colleagues in NHS England, Public Health England and the Alzheimer’s Society to raise the profile of dementia and the on-going work to support prevention, diagnosis and treatment of this condition.'

column5: Principal Private Secretary - Office of the Permanent Secretary
column6: 'Overview of all areas, Secretay of State and No.10 issues, Communications, DH finance & senior personnel, Departmental Capability, Governance'
'Leads the engagement with the NHS to design and deliver implementation of the migrant and visitor NHS cost recovery programme.  '
'Promoting evidence based policy making, delivering cross cutting analytical projects'

column5: Principal Private Secretary to the Secretary of State
column6: 'The provision of direct advice to Ministers; and management of Ministers' private offices'

'Development, with partners, of a comprehensive and constructive government response to the Mid Staffordshire Public Inquiry that supports the NHS to deliver consistently safe care with compassion and dignity.'

column5: Deputy Director - Citizen Voice and Insight
column6: 'Ensure that the voice of patients and citizens is heard across the health and care system and insights are acted on.'
'Delivering professional regulation in a way that reinforces quality.'
'Provision of analytical data to support Workforce policy areas.'

'Strategic leadership and coordination for the development and implementation of Departmental policy in respect of workforce information, availability and planning. Funding of education and training to support the development of the workforce.'

'Leads the Policy Communications team within the Communications Division. The team encompasses an account management team, who provide strategic communications support and work with policy teams to establish their communications needs, an events and visits team, a brand management team and a strategy and evaluation team.  '
'Provision of a 24/7 media relations service for ministers; senior officials and all policy teams in the department of Health. Responds to all journalist enquiries and interview requests.'

column6: 'Modernisation of NHS Pension and Pay arrangements.'
'Provide support to DH and its Arm's Length Bodies to address the medium to long term strategic challenge. Build strategic and horizon scanning capabilities across DH'

'NHSBU is responsible for briefing Ministers/Top of the Office on local NHS issues. This service is provided by liaising with a network of Parliamentary/Briefing managers based in the 10 Statutory Health Authoritiess. NHSBU is the first point of contact for DH colleagues looking for briefing on local NHS issues and also manages Ministerial Visits.'

column5: Deputy Director - CQC Sponsorship and Investigations
column6: 'Supporting the alignment of quality assurance processes across the sector, supporting effective sponsorship of CQC, and developing their legislative and policy framework'
'Provide support to DH and its Arm's Length Bodies to address the medium to long term strategic challenge. Build strategic and horizon scanning capabilities across DH'

column5: Director - Medicines Pharmacy and Industry Group
column6: 'Overall responsibility for: policy relating to medicines, including pricing, supply, clinical and cost effectiveness; sponsorship of the pharmaceutical and medical technology industries; pharmacy; prescription charges and the Commercial Medicines Unit.'

'The NHS Policy and Outcomes Group ensures effective implementation of health reform; supports health reform policy development; manages primary and secondary legislation; and supports NHS commissioning and provider policy.'

'PICD brings together all of the departments commercial and procurement activity to leverage expertise and achieve best value for money for the tax payer.  Responsible for ensuring the departments commercial decisions are well protected, best value is secured prom the private sector and it delivers the commercial objectives and programmes within the division and wider department.  Manage relationships with the private sector, with our business partners (such as Steria and the LIFT Council) and with the NHS and its commercial activities that are referred by the NHS (PFI)'
'Manages, oversees and undertakes capital, estate and revenue investment initiatives.  This includes the oversight and central management of NHS PFI and NHS LIFT programmes.'

'Responsible for the co-ordination and production of the DH Resource account and NHS Summarised accounts including collection of in year NHS financial information to support overall financial reporting and performance management.'

'Chief Medical Officer • Government’s Chief Advisor on: medical and public health issues; international health; research, and; emergency preparedness and resilience. • Protecting and improving the health of the nation. • Formulating and communicating policy, particularly around public health. • Providing national leadership for the medical profession. • Providing high level leadership for health research for the nation • Overseeing the health research system in England (National Institute for Health Research) • Obtaining and allocating the resources to enable the health research system to deliver its strategic aims.'
